title: Microsoft bans cryptomining in Azure
description: Microsoft Azure will only allow mining for crypto if written permission is granted by the company.

title: Microsoft has found a whole load of IoT and industrial cyber flaws
description: Microsoft research uncovers a wide range of industrial IoT vulnerabilities, a majority of which are available online.

title: Most US companies have already started investing in quantum computing
description: Report claims significant percentage of US companies have already started investing in quantum computing.

title: This Android browser might have leaked the details of millions of users
description: Android browser app was last updated two years ago, and has been leaking its users’ redirect data and more.

title: Microsoft’s campaign to popularize Edge appears to be paying off - but is it?
description: Microsoft has adopted some pervasive promotional tactics for its Edge browser, but how well are they really working?

title: Steam Deck 2 could have better screen and battery life – but not performance
description: And there could be a sequel to another famous piece of Valve hardware – but you’ll never guess what.

title: Epic Games to pull the plug on Rock Band's online servers, but the show's not over yet
description: Epic Games plans to take down its online Rock Band servers in January 2023 – and as Green Day would say, good riddance.

title: Microsoft Teams is fixing this tiny but super annoying quirk
description: We see you with hands up in the back, Microsoft Teams lurkers.

title: You'll soon be able to show off your coding skills in Google Docs
description: Google Workspace targets developers with easier code formatting in Docs.

title: There’s finally a reason to use Bing - to get free Overwatch 2 skins
description: Seen an Overwatch 2 skin you like but don't want to splash out? Then Bing is the search engine you need.

title: NSA warns Citrix devices are under attack from Chinese hackers, so update now
description: Citrix’s response might leave a lot to be desired, but there is at least a fix for the critical-level bug leaving enterprises wide open.

title: Watch out, Nvidia: overclocked AMD RX 7900 XTX matches RTX 4090 performance
description: A whopping 3.2GHz overclock sees AMD's flagship GPU square up against Nvidia's.

title: Adam Driver's dino movie is the futuristic Jurassic Park film I didn't know I wanted
description: The first trailer for Adam Driver's 65 movie has landed online – and it's the Jurassic Park-like film we've all secretly wished for.

title: US DoJ takes down 48 websites running huge "booster" DDoS network
description: Multinational effort to curb the DDoS-as a service market sees the FBI taking charge in seizures across two states.

title: God of War TV show gets the green light from Amazon
description: God of War is the latest game franchise to secure a TV deal, with a live-action adaptation picked up by Amazon Studios.

title: COBOL wants to find out just how popular it really is
description: New research project looks to understand how popular COBOL is, and will be in the future.

title: Windows 11 could get mystery package of features in May 2023
description: Is this a new Moment update inbound – it’d be number three – or something slightly beefier? It’s all a bit confusing.

title: Henry Cavill isn't returning as Superman – but his next project could be an ideal fit
description: Update: it seems Henry Cavill's next big role could be an Amazon Studios project that would be ideal for him.

title: Nvidia RTX 4090 Ti GPU spotted on Galax website – but don’t get your hopes up
description: This is an interesting one, with Galax mistakenly sticking up a banner bearing a 4090 Ti HOF graphics card.

title: The Oppo Find N2 line has landed, giving Samsung some foldable competition
description: The Oppo Find N2 and Oppo Find N2 Flip have both been unveiled, but only one is getting a global launch.

title: This free Apple Watch update lets you race yourself like Mario Kart
description: Apple Watch users can get loads of new features for free right now.
